content.text: HAPPY 50th Birthday May 2003 prove to BE the year you are most HAPPY Dear Son JEFF I have been very busy REMINISCING Since Ghislaine asked me to write about you for your book. I keep thinking about then and now. My father drove Seymour and me to the hospital that cold snowy day in January to become parents of a beautiful healthy son. Jeff You have been a good son from day one and we have been proud of you ever since

text_sections.full_transcription:
HAPPY 50th Birthday

May 2003 prove To BE
the year you are most HAPPY

Dear Son JEFF,
I have been very busy
REMINISCING Since Ghislaine
asked me to write about you for
your book. I keep thinking
about then and now.
My father drove Seymour and
me to the hospital that cold, snowy
day in January to become parents of
a beautiful, healthy son, Jeff.
you have been a good son from
day one and we have been proud
of you ever since. (1)

1

Document ID:
HOUSE_OVERSIGHT_000020

people.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
people.context: Asked Paula to write for birthday book

people.name: Seymour Epstein
people.context: Drove to hospital for Jeff's birth

relationships: Ghislaine Maxwell organized the birthday book
insights: Paula Epstein (mother) writes loving birthday message
CRITICAL: 'Ghislaine asked me to write about you for your book'
Confirms Maxwell personally contacted each contributor
Birth story: grandfather drove parents to hospital
'cold, snowy day in January' - winter birth confirmed
'good son from day one' - maintains positive view
'we have been proud of you ever since' - ongoing pride
No mention of criminal issues or controversies
Letter written in 2003 before legal troubles
Handwriting appears elderly - consistent with mother's age
forensic_notes: Ghislaine Maxwell's coordinating role documented by mother
Handwriting analysis: elderly female cursive style
No awareness of criminal activities evident
Page 1 of multi-page letter from mother
investigative_leads: Locate remaining pages of Paula's letter
Interview Paula Epstein about son's childhood
Verify hospital and birth records from January 1953
Analyze what Paula knew about son's activities
